page.title: 18SHEFFIELD PARK STATION
page.content: Built in 1882 to serve Lord Sheffields nearby country estate it is typical of country stations of the London Brighton and South Coast Railway. It has been restored to look like a country branch line station in the maroon and cream livery of the L B S C R, pre 1922. The signals, oil-lit platform lamps and signal box on the platform faithfully reproduce the railway scene of more than half a century ago. It is situated by the River Ouse just off the main A275 Lewes/East Grinstead Road. There is plenty to see and do a collection of 31 vintege locomotives, vintage enamel signs and a small museum. Take the train for a trip on the Bluebell Railway. {D Skan
